oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 45 g
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 45 g. Newspaper clipping: (fragment) 'If the predictions in this ward are true...'
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Voting; Voter registration;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: If the predictions in this ward are true then there will have to be on an average of 100 votes polled every minute, or one every thirty-six seconds, and accord- ing to these figures the booths will be crowded every minute of the day. In the fourteenth ward, Park City, more than 1,000 persons have registered and the same thing will be true as to the voting on election day as in the eleventh ward. Roy H. Beeler, chairman of the commissioners of election, says that he has already urged several of the leaders in the women's non-partisan league to bring this matter before the members, in order to assure everybody a vote. Additional booths will be placed in the larger wards of the city by the commissioners of election and all preparations will be made to accommodate the vast crowd on the day of the contest. In making out the list of election officers, the commissioners took into consideration the fact that the vote will be exceedingly heavy, and men were appointed as clerks who could quickly enter the names of those voting and who could count the ballots at a rapid rate. Mr. Beeler says he hopes the public in general will bear in mind these facts and assist the commission and those who have been appointed to hold the election as far as possible.
